  2. Duolingo CEO admits his controversial AI memo ‘did not give enough context’ and insists the company never laid off full-time employees  Yahoo Finance
  3. Duolingo CEO takes the blame for backlash over ‘AI-first’ plans  Quartz
  4. Duolingo Stock (DUOL) Soared after CEO Clarified “AI-First” Strategy: “We’re Not Replacing Humans”  TipRanks
  5. How is Duolingo's AI Strategy Affecting Southeast Asia?  Tech in Asia

item.title: AI could spark a $16 trillion boom for stocks, Morgan Stanley says - Business Insider
item.description:
1. AI could spark a $16 trillion boom for stocks, Morgan Stanley says  Business Insider
  2. The AI revolution will cut nearly $1 trillion a year out of S&P 500 budgets, Morgan Stanley says—largely from agents and robots doing human jobs  Fortune
  3. How Much Is AI Worth to Stocks? Try $16 Trillion.  Barron's
  4. AI may save firms nearly $1 trillion a year in wages, study finds  Axios
  5. AI adoption could add billions to S&P 500, says Morgan Stanley  The Times

item.title: MIT report: 95% of generative AI pilots at companies are failing - Fortune
item.description:
1. MIT report: 95% of generative AI pilots at companies are failing  Fortune
  2. The ‘shadow AI economy’ is booming: Workers at 90% of companies say they use chatbots, but most of them are hiding it from IT  Yahoo Finance
  3. MIT Report Finds Most AI Business Investments Fail, Reveals 'GenAI Divide'  Virtualization Review
  4. MIT Report On Gen AI Struggles Spooks Investors. Analyst Sees Opening For IBM And These Stocks.  Investor's Business Daily
  5. Companies have invested billions into AI, 95 percent getting zero return  The Hill
